description: Test suite reduction involves minimizing the number of test cases in a test suite while still maintaining adequate coverage of the codebase. This is particularly important for large projects where running all tests can be time-consuming and inefficient.
you_have_this_if: You have a large number of test cases that take a long time to execute.
You notice that many tests are redundant or provide little additional value.
You are facing challenges in maintaining test cases for legacy code.
You want to improve the efficiency of your testing process without sacrificing quality.
You are looking for ways to optimize resource usage in your CI/CD pipeline.

approaches.technique: Unsupervised Machine Learning for Test Suite Reduction
approaches.best_for: when you need to optimize a large test suite while maintaining high code coverage.
approaches.key_tradeoff: This approach may require significant initial setup and understanding of machine learning concepts.

decision_matrix.technique: Unsupervised Machine Learning for Test Suite Reduction
decision_matrix.best_when: You have a large test suite and need to reduce it while ensuring that critical functionalities are still tested.

start_here: The recommended first approach for most cases is to apply Unsupervised Machine Learning for Test Suite Reduction, as it effectively balances the need for fewer tests with the requirement for maintaining code coverage.
